name: Kasie Dunham
text: The concession stand food was great!

name: Beverly Poellnitz
text: Covered stands are great. Clean restrooms. Grounds kept up very well. Concession stand has reasonable pricing with hot dogs, hamburgers, chicken fingers, nachos & cheese as well as fries. Wonderful lemonade and a good variety of soft drinks. Great safe place for a family outing.

name: Thomas Guy
text:
Had a good time at the sports complex.
Appears to be supported by a great community. The covers over the seating is very nice and a good idea for spectators.

name: clang theo
text: Great place for the community to come together to support youth sports. The new covered pavilions are a plus. Concessions are always very good. Grounds are well kept.

name: Nicole Snow
text: It's a nice facility.....but it smells awful at nite fall because the city sewer station is across from the ball fields!!! Just awful!

name: Tawanda Turner
text: Ball Park

name: Kyle Turner
text: It's our home away from home

name: Ken Meeks
text: Ok ball park.

name: Brittney Elmer
text: This was a very cool place to go. Beautiful scenery. Bathrooms were nice compared to other outdoor venues I've been to.

name: Bob Crawford
text: Great venue for music and the annual fireworks show. Beautiful hill overlooking Lake Martin.

name: Debbie Muglio
text: Large open area on a hill so every lawn spot is good for viewing the stage. Sounds great!    Dirt road to get to it. Clean large bathrooms. Lawn is very well maintained and great view of Lake Martin

name: Raymond Kent
text: Fantastic!!! This is the 2nd year I have attended the 4th of July celebration with my family. Each trip is equally wonderful. The cost was $10 per person, which included 3.5 hours of live music and a 30 minute fireworks display that is in my opinion legendary. The grounds are very clean and we'll maintained. You can't be more safe, they have numerous officers from Russell Lands Security on hand, as well as countless County Deputies and enough fire and EMS personnel to handle any situation that may arise. Each service has their own tented area at the top of the hill and is easily identified. The personnel also maintain a high presence that is not only authoritative but very friendly especially to the children. The restroom facilities are actual buildings. They are well stocked, clean, ventilated and conveniently located from the venue viewing area. The view is unbelievable. The stage is front and center before the fireworks, but is moved to the side to give an unobstructed view of the fireworks and the lake. Its amazing to see the amount of boats that gather to listen to the music and watch the fireworks. When the lights go out, the lake looks like a sky full of stars with all the boat lights. If you have the opportunity to attend an event at the amp, go...... You wont be disappointed.

name: Denise Knight
text: Great 4th of July show. Clean and comfortable. Kowaliga fire dept very friendly

name: Megan Talentino
text: Beautiful place, it looks like it would be a great venue.

name: Night Watcher
text: Enjoyed the evening. Fireworks were nice, could have ended better. The music was sub par and definitely could have been better. Overall, it was enjoyable.

name: Sheila C
text: Great fireworks show! Stepped in a hole knee deep in the parking lot. Think it's sprang, hope not broke...

name: Fred Worsham IV
text: No matter if your rented out the spot for a meeting or your there to see someone, the staff is polite and knows the information of the building or where to direct you. Is in a good location for around Alexander City. Not all the way down town but as soon as you get into it right off the highway.
